title: Understand the Binomial Theorem
text: The binomial theorem provides a formula to expand expressions of the form $${\left(a+b\right)}^n$$ without fully expanding it. Instead, you can find specific terms in the expansion using a specific formula.

title: Identify Term Formula
text: The formula for a specific term in a binomial expansion is given by $$\binom{n}{k}a**{n-k}b**k$$, $$where$$ $$n$$ $$is$$ $$the$$ $$power$$, $$k$$ $$is$$ $$the$$ $$term$$ $$number$$ $$minus$$ $$1$$, $$and$$ $$a$$, $$b$$ $$are$$ $$the$$ $$terms$$ $$in$$ $$the$$ $$binomial$$.

title: Calculate the Binomial Coefficient
text: Use the formula (n choose k) to calculate the binomial coefficient for the tenth term.

title: Calculate Powers of Each Term
text: What are the powers of $$x$$ and $$2y$$ for the tenth term in the expansion? Please enter your answer as "x**a, y**b" where a and $$b$$ are the respective powers.

title: Combine the Terms
text: Multiply the binomial coefficient by the corresponding powers of $$x$$ and $$y$$ to find the term.
